caption:
After a challenging childhood being raised by a single mom and getting kicked out by his stepdad at 13, @brentprimus155 turned to street fighting to get out his anger.

Then “one day I woke up and realized I’m gonna end up in prison if I keep doing what I’m doing.” When a friend introduced him to jiu jitsu, “everything changed.”

“Jiu jitsu changed my mindset — there was so much respect and honor and discipline and hard work that went into it.”

20 years later, Brent has made a professional career out of it in the PFL. He prides himself on being the hardest worker in the room — and being the father he didn’t have for his kids.

“There’s no greater motivation than wanting to be a good dad and a role model for them. I think it’s super important that they see me working out, eating healthy, staying hydrated — they’re gonna reflect it.

“I want to be the best version of myself for them.”

Brent has his first fight in the 2025 PFL tournament on Friday, April 18. Good luck, Brent — and Stay Salty ⚡
